item.title: "Refining Ideas: Six-Week Hackathon Concept Explored"
item.description:
i've been thinking about the 6 week hackathon format

week 1: work on 64 barebones ideas
week 2: forced to cut down 32, and continue working on 32 remaining ideas
week 3: cut down 16, work on the remaining 16
...
week 6: last 2 ideas, cut down one and publish last one

this is…

— HudZah ⁂ (@hud_zah) July 30, 2024

item.title: Seeking High Voltage DC Power Supply in Waterloo/Toronto
item.description:
does anyone in waterloo/toronto know where i can find or borrow a -30kV to -50kV DC power supply that can also go upto ~10mA?

or generally know of ppl who work with high voltage stuff nearby!

most of these cost $10k USED and its kinda frustrating to find

item.title: "AI-Assisted Kitchen Fusion: A Nuclear Breakthrough"
item.description:
over a 36-hour livestream, I built a neutron-producing nuclear fusor in my kitchen using Claude.

successfully achieving nuclear fusion, entirely assisted by AI.

this was my first hardware project!—full story below pic.twitter.com/yuvjE5IHFb

— HudZah ⁂ (@hud_zah) January 17, 2025

item.title: "Why Mosquitos Prefer Me Over My Siblings in Sri Lanka"
item.description:
i noticed that while in sri lanka a ton of mosquitos would bite me more than my siblings.

i looked into this and found that:
- mosquitos are attracted to darker clothing (absorbs more heat)
- people with type O blood are more attractive to mosquitos.

I tested this and…

— HudZah ⁂ (@hud_zah) January 4, 2025

item.title: The Efficiency of Newspaper Production and Delivery Explained
item.description:
it’s underrated how robust newspaper production and delivery has been. stories written, published, printed and shipped in 24 hours, everyday!

does anyone have readings on how this supply chain worked?

item.title: "Is First Class Really the Safest Place on a Plane?"
item.description:
i find it strange that first class is positioned at the front of the plane when statistically its the most dangerous place to be during a crash.

wouldn't it be a great incentive to pay more to sit further back on the plane and have a higher boost in survival?

— HudZah ⁂ (@hud_zah) December 29, 2024

item.title: Pros and Cons of First Class Boarding Strategy
item.description:
pros: makes more sense during boarding, first class fills up back of plane first so less clogging

cons: economy and business passengers don't walk past the first class luxury and don't have the feeling of "oh i wish that was me"

— HudZah ⁂ (@hud_zah) December 29, 2024
